alert.note: Alert for Elk; Greenwood; Wilson; Woodson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 29 at 9:21PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Elk, northwestern Wilson, Woodson and southeastern Greenwood Counties through 945 PM CDT... At 921 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Severy, or 11 miles northeast of Howard, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Yates Center, Toronto, Severy, Fall River, Climax, Virgil, New Albany, Coyville, Toronto Lake, Batesville, Fall River State Park, Fall River Lake and Cross Timbers State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Kansas.
